sponsor.partnerMessage: Since 1957, Underwoods has been committed to quality and value. Named "Coolest Store in America" by InStore Magazine, and winner of state, national, and international design awards, Underwoods' dedication to craftsmanship and design excellence creates timeless jewelry.

posts.title: Art Walk Becomes Art 'Dance' In Downtown Rogers Tonight
posts.content:
The Art on the Bricks Art Walk in downtown Rogers returns tonight and the theme is “Perpetual Motion,” named after an aerial dance company who will be performing tonight.

  • Some events: Downtown Rogers will be active with opportunities for dance classes and lessons from barre to hip hop to freestyle. The event will also host live art talks and interactive opportunities for the community at local venues.
  • Shows: As a part of a national tour, Perpetual Motion Dance will perform an original show called Y20 at 6p and 7p at Turntable Plaza in the Railyard Park. Stop by before or after a show to see featured artists in Ozark Beer Company, Brick & Mortar, and the ANA Gallery. 

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Momentary Releases Its 2022 Sumer Guide
posts.content:
It’s never dull at the Momentary, especially in the summertime with new exhibits and concerts on the horizon.

  • A happenin' place: In addition to new interactive art exhibitions spanning the Momentary grounds, you can expect to see new sculptures, screenings, and new sound. The Live on the Green series is lined up for the rest of the year with great musical talent.
  • Listen & learn: The two Live on the Green concerts this summer are Kraftwerk 3-D on June 26 and Run the Jewels & Big Boi on July 16. The War on Drugs is coming in September, and Lyle Lovett & John Hiatt in October.

Read more about the Momentary's summer plans HERE.

posts.title: Razorback Baseball Team Advances To The Super Regionals
posts.content:
The Diamond Hogs are in the NCAA postseason Super Regional round after a 7-3 win over Oklahoma State on Monday.

  • Baseball: This weekend, the Super Regional games will be in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, with the Hogs playing the University of North Carolina Tar Heels in a best-of-three. The first two games will be Saturday at 10a and Sunday at 12p, and the winner will advance to the College World Series in Omaha. 
  • Weekend Recap: If you didn't have a chance to watch all 12+ hours of Arkansas baseball last weekend, here is a quick recap: The Stillwater Regional set NCAA records for most runs (148) and most home runs (41) at a postseason site. Arkansas contributed to 48 of those runs and a number of HRs including a grand slam.

Read more about last weekend and upcoming games HERE.

posts.title: MBA Program Presents Global Immersion Experience
posts.topic: Sponsored by the Walton MBA Program at the University of Arkansas
posts.content:
The Walton Executive MBA program offers a broad knowledge of how business fits together and is ready to transform your life and accelerate your career. 

  • Critically acclaimed: The Wall Street Journal recently ranked the Walton MBA program #11 out of 600 programs for its return on investment, and U.S. News & World Reports ranked the program as the 36th best public MBA in the nation. 
  • Designed for you: The program is 2-years, primarily online, with one in-person Saturday each month designed to network with your cohort and faculty. You will also have the opportunity to travel the world in a global immersion experience through the program. The program starts in the fall, and GMAT/GRE waivers are available now. 

Learn more and apply HERE before July 1.

posts.title: Global Business Acquires Fayetteville Tech Startup
posts.content:
A Fayetteville tech startup was recently acquired by a global business based in the United Kingdom to bring human connection to a digital world. 

  • More personal: The Fayetteville startup, Gratavid, is a video platform that helps organizations stay connected to their donors through personalized videos. The platform recently merged with Graduway + Gravyty, which have operations in the U.S., Canada, and Israel. 
  • Trifecta: With Gravidad joining Graduway + Gravyty, it creates an ecosystem of products that automate the way communication flows within non-profits and education organizations. The trio now work with 2,500+ schools, colleges, non-profits, and healthcare organizations globally. 

Learn more HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily
pick.content:
• Reduce drafts: Boost your home comfort with no-cost air and duct sealing from SWEPCO.*
  • Playing with dad: Get your dad the best Father's Day gift this year and sign up for the Papa Loves Pickleball Tournament at PB&JJ's on June 19.*
  • Birthday party: First National Bank is hosting a concert on Thursday, complete with food, beer, and cornhole for its 150th birthday, and you're invited!*
  • Top-notch: A 30-second TV commercial produced to promote U of A won the highest award administered by the Association of Marketing and Communications Professionals. 
  • Supporting community: Tyson Foods has recently donated over one million meals through NWA pantries. 
  • Get in here: Let us know about your organization's initiative or event, and check out our advertising options HERE.
